form.name: mild_hypothermia
form.page_subtitle: PNC Diagnostic Newborn: Very Severe Disease & Local Bacterial Infections> Mild Hypothermia

field.name: Warm the baby skin to skin, cover baby with a blanket, and more clothes
If the baby can feed, help mother to breastfeed
If the baby cannot breastfeed, give small sips of expressed breast milk that’s been collected in a clean container with a lid
If temperature is not increasing (≥ 36.5 C) after 2 hours, give extra warmth and refer mother and baby to a health center
If any danger signs present, refer to a health center or hospital IMMEDIATELY
If baby is not able to breastfeed, give small sips of expressed breast milk that has been collected in a clean container with a lid
Advise mother to not put the baby on her back
Teach mother how to keep the baby warm on the way to the health facility
Record baby’s clinical information in client’s maternal health or “Red” book. If possible, also fill out referral form
Accompany mother and baby, and have a family member accompany mother and baby to the health facility
Follow up with client after discharge from health center or hospital
